definition: one of the five legendary emperors, also called 高辛氏[Gao1 xin1 shi4]
"cover" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 14), occurring in 軍|军[jun1], 冠[guan1] etc, known as 禿寶蓋|秃宝盖[tu1 bao3 gai4] or 平寶蓋|平宝盖[ping2 bao3 gai4]
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
Di Ku or Emperor Ku, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], great-grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]

sentences.english: Emperor Ku kept his words, and allow Long Qi to marry the third princess.
sentences.chinese: 喾帝履行承诺，准许龙麒和三公主成婚。

definition: wife or senior concubine of husbands older brother (old)/elder sister (old)
surname Yao/Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
to amputate one or both feet (punishment in imperial China)/see also 五刑[wu3 xing2]
Zhuan Xu, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4], trad. reigned 2513-2435 BC
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
"blade of grass" component in Chinese characters
